TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RegistryValueOptions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies optional behavior when retrieving name/value pairs from a registry key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DoNotExpandEnvironmentNames flag with the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.GetValue%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CMicrosoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions%29?displayProperty=fullName> method overload.
## Examples The following code sample creates a test key, adds a value with an embedded environment variable, and retrieves the value in both expanded and unexpanded forms.
[!code-cs[RegistryValueOptions#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-microsoft.win32.regist_4_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[RegistryValueOptions#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-microsoft.win32.regist_4_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[RegistryValueOptions#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-microsoft.win32.regist_4_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions DoNotExpandEnvironmentNames = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A value of type <xref:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.ExpandString?displayProperty=fullName> is retrieved without expanding its embedded environment variables.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions None = int32(0)
